text:
I have a small slideshow-type SVG app that I use to walk through a few hundred
SVG graphs. Using the Squiggle browser, I always get an out of memory exception.
I can duplicate this with the 1.5.1 distribution and the 12-16-2004 CVS build.

On the 1.5.1 distribution, it consistently gets the error at around 260 images
(+/- 1). In the CVS version (12-16-2004) it gets all the way to 360.

If I watch the memory monitor, the memory usage climbs pretty steadily. It may
drop once in a while, but it always continues rising.
creator: gwadej@anomaly.org

text:
Created attachment 13851
Test case that displays the bug.

This tar file contains the full code needed to duplicate the bug.

1. Expand the tar file.
2. Load colorProfiles.svg in Squiggle.
3. Click the blue button.

About 260-360 graphs will go by and then you will get an OutOfMemory exception.
creator: gwadej@anomaly.org

text:
This memory leak is now fixed in CVS.
The root of the problem is that the DocumentLoader's
document cache used Hard references, so no documents
were ever released once loaded into the JVM.
creator: deweese@apache.org
